column2: Has a §YLiege§!, §YVassal§!, or a §Yneighboring ruler§! who follows the §YBritannic§! faith\n
column3: A un §Yseigneur lige§!, un §Yvassal§! ou un §Yvoisin§! qui suit la religion §Ybritannique§!\n
column4: Hat einen §YLehnsherrn§!, §YVasallen§! oder §Ybenachbarten Herrscher§!, der dem §YBritannisch§! Glauben folgt\n
column6: Tiene un §Yseñor§!, §Yvasallo§!, o §Ygobernante vecino§! que sigue la fe §Ybritannica§! \n

column2: The Brittanic religion is a monotheistic offshoot of Druidic belief focused on the goddess Britannia, the personification of the British Isles. She is viewed as a mother goddess and is worshipped to the exclusion of all other gods from Celtic tradition. The priesthood is entirely composed of women known as Dryads, with the Arch-Dryad as the supreme spiritual authority. Brittanics also venerate a host of saints and Sanctaidd, divine servants of the Holy Mother that are much like angels in Abrahamic tradition. Most of the Sanctaidd are considered gods amongst the Druids.
The Circle of Dryads is the highest governing body in the Church of Britannia. It's sole duty is to elect the next Arch-Dryad.
This Dryad is probably the next in line for a seat at the Circle.
Of all the Dryads in my realm, this one is the most likely to be appointed a seat at the Circle by the Arch-Dryad.

This character is a dryad, a Britannic priestess. Dryads are highly educated women and are expected to conduct themselves honorably. They are also expected to have at least one child in their lifetime, so Celibacy and Chastity are frowned upon.
This Dryad has conducted herself in ways unbecoming of her station. She is an embarassment to Britannic teachings and other Dryads will be reluctant to deal with her.
This character is a Morrigan, a veteran of a Britannic Great Holy War.
Britannics that never received a Tumtha are known as Sych, or "dry". They will always have difficult relations with other Britannics, especially the church.
As a child of a Dryad, this character is considered blessed by the Britannic Church.
This character is a skilled leader of cavalry and flat terrain.
Hold a Church Council to establish an Arch-Dryad as the head of the Britannic Church.
Must have at least 16 Dryads to hold a Church Council
Hold an Imbolg, a fertility festival dedicated largely to Saint Brigid.
Request that [Root.GetTitledFirstName] officiate a Tumoidechais for a child in your court. Any child who does not have a Tumoidechais by the age of 3 will be known as Sych.
Has access to the sea via counties in the same realm.
By making a large donation to the church, as a symbol of support and submition to the Arch-Dryad, we can be sure she will not attempt to interfere in our affairs for 10 years.
This province has volunteers and clergy providing relief to the locals from an outbreak of disease.
This character experienced a good, if uneventful, Tumoidechais.
This character's Tumoidechais was plagued with storms, a sign of Britannia's disfavor.
This character is currently holding Imbolg, a Britannic fertility festival.
Borrowed from the Knights of Saint Boudicca
Expelled the Knights of Saint Boudicca
